Class LionsLambs

  • java.lang.Object
    • LionsLambs

  • public class LionsLambs
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class, gets user input manages board states and communicates with AI

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Agent[] board
      board representation board stores Agent objects which can be either Lions or Lambs scoreHistory stores all the scores of the boards ever used
      static int LAMB_COUNT 
      static int LAMB_KILLED 
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> scoreHistory 
      static int TURN 
      static int WIN_STATE
      Global variables used to track the game state

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LionsLambs() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void init()
      Initialises board, places a Lion object on each corner
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      If arguments are given in the form of integers, use this as target depth in the state tree In conversation with Leopold type "ai" when Leopold asks if you want to play with him to let him play both sides.
      static void playGame(java.lang.String player)
      Game loop, draws board, gives updates to player about game state.
      static int[] readInput()
      Reads user integer input used to determine moves When only one integer is given the second integer is set to 9001 to indicate the placement of a lamb at position one
      static void setMove(int pos1, int pos2)
      Edits the board, calculating if a lamb has been killed by looking if the move was a jump.
      static java.lang.String stringRead()
      Reads user string input used for the starting dialog, casts input to lowercase

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        Initialises board, places a Lion object on each corner

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        If arguments are given in the form of integers, use this as target depth in the state tree In conversation with Leopold type "ai" when Leopold asks if you want to play with him to let him play both sides.

      • playGame

        public static void playGame(java.lang.String player)
        Game loop, draws board, gives updates to player about game state. The main game loop continues until a player has won. The sub game loop continues until a valid move has been made by a player after which the TURN is changed and the loop is broken.
        Parameters:
        player - A string with the player choice of the player

      • readInput

        public static int[] readInput()
        Reads user integer input used to determine moves When only one integer is given the second integer is set to 9001 to indicate the placement of a lamb at position one
        Returns:
        Integer array with the desired move

      • stringRead

        public static java.lang.String stringRead()
        Reads user string input used for the starting dialog, casts input to lowercase
        Returns:
        String with user input

      • setMove

        public static void setMove(int pos1,
           int pos2)
        Edits the board, calculating if a lamb has been killed by looking if the move was a jump. Adds the score of the board to the history.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - starting position of piece
        pos2 - final position of piece
